definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: lit. you cannot get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. learn to walk before you run
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 bu4 cheng2 pang4 zi5

definition: readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
fat (e.g. pork fat)/fatty meat/(fig.) a gold mine/cash cow
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
